Title: GED4ALL socio-economic taxonomy
Definition: The socio-economic taxonomy defined in the Global Exposure Database for Multi-Hazard Risk Analysis (GED4ALL).

Title: MOVER social vulnerability categories
Definition: The social vulnerability categories defined in the Multi-Hazard Open Vulnerability Platform for Evaluating Risk (MOVER).

Title: Global Identifier Numbers
Definition: Identification codes generated by GLIDE since 2004 for all new disaster events reported by the Asian Disaster Reduction Center and GLIDE partner organizations.

Title: EM-DAT International Disaster Database
Definition: EM-DAT contains data on the occurrence and impacts of over 26,000 mass disasters worldwide from 1900 to the present day. The database is compiled from various sources, including UN agencies, non-governmental organizations, reinsurance companies, research institutes, and press agencies. The Centre for Research on the Epidemiology of Disasters (CRED) distributes the data in open access for non-commercial use.

Title: USGS Earthquake Hazards Program
Definition: The USGS monitors and reports on earthquakes globally, assigning each reported event a unique identifier. These event identifiers are used in the associated USGS products including PAGER, ShakeMap and DYFI.
